content.title: General
content.fullText: Every extra-low voltage circuit shall be individually protected at its origin against overload and short-circuit currents by a protective device that: (a) Shall comply with the applicable requirements of Clauses 2.2 and 2.5. (b) May be provided in one conductor less than the number of conductors in the circuit. Where the extra-low voltage supply is earthed at the point of supply, the protective devices shall be installed in all the unearthed conductors. Exception: Circuits arranged in accordance with Clause 7.5.9.2 need not be provided with overcurrent protection.
